result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

CASE NOT CALLED

Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for MAXWELL A DECKER ON 2022CF101. Atty Karl Green not present.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court sets cases for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.
Letter to the Court from Atty Green dated October 21, 2022 re: correction to previous letter with an updated case number

2:51 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green appeared by video for MAXWELL A DECKER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF28, 2022CF46 & 2022CF101. On 2022CF101 - Atty Kapelis was appointed on this case. 2022CF28 & 2022CF46 - Court denies the motion to dismiss. Statement by the defendant - Atty kapelis withdrew. Court sets 2022CF101 - for Status of Counsel on October 24, 2022 at 3:15 PM and will track the other 2 cases. Court questions Atty Green if he would take a court appointment if no attorney was appointed in this case. Statement by Atty Green.

Court adjourned at 2:55 PM
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (for Atty Green)
Letter to the Court from Atty Karl Green dated September 29, 2022 re: request to appear via zoom
Status hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:56 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green not in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court - Atty Green was on zoom and the Court had to end the zoom and switch to Marquette county to do bond hearings. Atty Green is not on zoom. Court sets for Status hearing on October 4, 2022 at 2:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 3:57 PM
Status hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:49 PM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green in court for MAXWELL A DECKER on 2022CF46 & 2022CF28. Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for Maxwell Decker on 2022CF101.   Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls all cases 2022CF46, 2022CF101 and 2022CF28. On 2022CF28-Court goes over the motion filed by the defense and will hold open and file a written decision. 

Atty Green states the defendant will waive the prelim on 2022CF46. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Green. Attorney Green waives any reading. Atty Green states the defendant stands mute. Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

2022CF101 Statement by Atty Kapelis - defendant requests a prelim be scheduled. Statement by DA, had contact with the victim in which the defendant has made contact with her via text.

Court adjourned at 3:56 PM

Court sets 2022CF101 for Preliminary Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

8:55 AM Defendant MAXWELL A DECKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Green in court for MAXWELL A DECKER on 2022CF28 & 2022CF46 and has not yet been retained on 2022CF101 but is making a special appearance.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF101, 2022CF28 & 2022CF46. Atty Green confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 cash bond on each case and conditions of: 2022CF101-No Contact with the victim ABC or her immediate family or residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits on each case. Court will set for Status of Prelim ion June 21, 2022 at 3:15 PM.

Court adjourned at 8:59 AM

2022CF101 - Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.
